agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Corrections TIME & DATE: 8:00 AM, Thursday, April 11, 2019 PLACE: E2.030 CHAIR: Rep. James White Public testimony will be limited to 3 minutes. The order in which bills will be heard is at the discretion of the chair. HB 1115 White Relating to law enforcement agency policies regarding the placement of a child taken into possession by a peace officer during a person's arrest and placement information provided to the person. HB 1271 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to the award of good conduct time to certain inmates; changing parole eligibility. HB 1956 Dutton Relating to certain contract and notice requirements applicable to certain facilities used to house inmates or releasees from the Texas Department of Criminal Justice. HB 2481 Metcalf Relating to the administration of a veterans treatment court program and the eligibility for deferred adjudication community supervision of certain defendants who are eligible to participate in a veterans treatment court program and who committed certain intoxication offenses and the conditions of that supervision. HB 2772 Wilson Relating to the release to mandatory supervision of certain inmates confined in a county jail. HB 3015 Talarico Relating to educational requirements for inmates who are younger than 18 years of age. HB 3297 Allen Relating to the revocation of community supervision for a violation of a condition of community supervision involving the commission of an offense. HB 3303 Bowers Relating to the revocation of community supervision for a violation of a condition of community supervision committed by a defendant who is the primary caretaker of a child or is pregnant. HB 3472 Bailes Relating to a rodeo hosted by the Texas Department of Criminal Justice; authorizing a fee. HB 3512 Pacheco Relating to community supervision. HB 3529 Gutierrez Relating to a domestic violence pilot program. HB 3620 Reynolds Relating to the creation of a mental health treatment for incarceration diversion pilot program. HB 3978 Gutierrez Relating to a defendant making a specified donation in lieu of working a specified number of hours at a community service project. HB 4009 Toth Relating to the establishment, operation, and funding of victim-offender mediation programs; authorizing fees. HB 4104 White Relating to the sentencing procedures and punishment for the offense of prostitution and to programs for certain defendants charged with or convicted of prostitution. HB 4594 González, Jessica Relating to the punishment for certain possession offenses under the Texas Controlled Substances Act; changing eligibility for and conditions of community supervision. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
